Basic Examples.label: Recursion
Basic Examples.text:
def fibonacci(n: int) -> int
	if n < 2
		return n

	return fibonacci(n - 1) + fibonacci(n - 2)

print("Calculating the 40th fibonacci number:")
# Should be 102334155
print(fibonacci(40))

Basic Examples.label: C Functions (FFI)
Basic Examples.text:
def extern strlen(x: str) -> int

print(strlen("Hello World"))

Basic Examples.label: Imports
Basic Examples.text:
from time import sleep

sleep(0.5)
print("Phew! That took a while!")

Basic Examples.label: Enums
Basic Examples.text:
enum Color
	RED
	BLUE
	GREEN

var favorite_color: Color = Color.RED

def isRed(color: Color) -> bool
	return color == Color.RED

print(isRed(favorite_color))

Basic Examples.label: Classes

Complete Examples.label: String Class
Complete Examples.text:
# Let's make our own String class!

def extern malloc(size: int) -> *int8
def extern strcpy(dest: str, src: str) -> str
def extern strlen(src: str) -> int

class String
	var x: str
	var length: int
	var capacity: int

	def new(x: str)
		self.length = strlen(x)
		self.capacity = self.length
		self.x = malloc(self.capacity) as str
		strcpy(self.x, x)

let my_class = String("Hello World!")
print(my_class.x)

Complete Examples.label: Guessing Game
Complete Examples.text:
print("Guess the number! ğŸ°")

let secret_number = random(1, 101)

while true
	let guess = input("Please input your guess: ")
	let guessed_number = strToInt(guess)

	if guessed_number > secret_number
		print("Too big!")
	else if guessed_number < secret_number
		print("Too small")
	else
		print("You win!")
		break
